intro: Pedilonum dryadum, commonly known as the dryad's slipper, is a unique flowering plant characterized by its striking, slipper-shaped petals. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are often a mix of white and green, with a subtle fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Pedilonum dryadum is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
